metadata.title: CVE-2019-18603 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenAFS before 1.6.24 and 1.8.x before 1.8.5 is prone to informationleakage upon certain error conditions because uninitialized RPC outputvariables are sent over the network to a peer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18603` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libafsauthent2 - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
libafsrpc2 - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
libkopenafs2 - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-client - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-dbserver - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-fileserver - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-fuse - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-krb5 - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-modules-dkms - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-modules-source - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openafs package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2').
